comments.body:
If I remove it, the build fails with:
```
Error:(1012, 44) not found: type DaysWritable
  private def getDateWritable(value: Any): DaysWritable =
```
I moved `DaysWritable` from `sql/hive` to `sql/core` to reuse it in ORC.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +33,37 @@import org.apache.spark.sql.catalyst.expressions._
import org.apache.spark.sql.catalyst.util._
import org.apache.spark.sql.execution.datasources.DaysWritable
import org.apache.spark.sql.types
import org.apache.spark.sql.types._

comments.body: The bug fix should be made independently from the PR, I think.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +495,499 @@      case poi: WritableConstantTimestampObjectInspector =>
        val t = poi.getWritableConstantValue
        val constant = DateTimeUtils.fromJavaTimestamp(t.getTimestamp)
        _ => constant
      case poi: WritableConstantIntObjectInspector =>

comments.body: Gregorian year is shorter than Julian year: 365.2425 days vs 365.25 days, so the same local date in Gregorian calendar requires less days in Julian calendar.
